articles.title: Pyongyang Sinmun Marks 60th Foundation Day
articles.content:
Pyongyang Sinmun Marks 60th Foundation Day
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Sinmun, one of the DPRK's newspapers, marked its 60th founding anniversary.
					 It serves as a mass political paper speaking for the stand of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and a close company of Pyongyang citizens as it encourages them to perform feats.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung founded the Pyongyang Sinmun on June 1, Juche 46 (1957) and personally named the title of the newspaper and gave concrete instructions about its content, form and method of editing.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il gave meticulous guidance to the newspaper, saw to it that editing became diverse to meet its characteristics and features and highly appreciated its successful journalists.
					
					 Over the past 60 years, the Pyongyang Sinmun has developed into an authoritative medium of the country under the wise guidance and loving care of the great leaders, creditably discharging its mission to instill the Party's revolutionary ideas into the citizens and encourage them to the implementation of the Party policies.
					
					 A meeting took place on Wednesday to mark the anniversary.
					
					 It was attended by Kim Ki Nam, vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK, and officials, journalists, editors and employees of the medium.

articles.title: Photo Exhibition Opens to Mark Anniversary of KCU
articles.content:
Photo Exhibition Opens to Mark Anniversary of KCU
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition "The sun and sunflowers" opened with due ceremony at the Central Youth Hall on Wednesday to mark the 71st anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU).
					 On display at the exhibition are photos showing the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un who have trained the rising generations to be pillars of prosperous Korea.
					
					 Also there are photos showing the bright and cheerful KCU members who are preparing themselves to be the successors to the revolutionary cause of Juche, the reliable reserves of the Songun revolution, under the benevolent care of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK, and others, officials of the youth league, teachers and schoolchildren in the city.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the C.C., the youth league, made an opening address.

articles.title: Delegation of Ministry of Railways Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
Delegation of Ministry of Railways Leaves for Russia
Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Ministry of Railways led by Minister Jang Hyok left here for Russia Wednesday to attend the 45th ministerial meeting of the Organization of Railways Cooperation to be held in Sochi.

articles.title: World No Tobacco Day Observed
articles.content:
World No Tobacco Day Observed
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- An event marking World No Tobacco Day took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday.
					 It was attended by public health workers and officials of the relevant units and the representative of the WHO, and members of other international bodies here and foreign embassy officials.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Referring to the subject of nonsmoking campaign set forth by the WHO for this year, the speakers said that smoking causes various diseases and seriously damages the human health and adversely affects the social and economic life.
					
					 They underlined the need to intensify the scientific researches into development of more tobacco substitutes and tighten the control over smoking in public centers.
					
					 Then, a briefing was given on the amended and supplemented tobacco control law of the DPRK.
					
					 The participants watched a video showing harmfulness of smoking and an art performance given by students of Kim Hyong Jik University of Education.
					
					 Meanwhile, nonsmoking campaign was conducted at the central and provincial hygienic information service centers and preventive and curative institutions.

articles.title: DPRK's April 25 Team Advances to Next Stage of 2017 AFC Cup
articles.content:
DPRK's April 25 Team Advances to Next Stage of 2017 AFC Cup
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The second match between DPRK's Kigwancha football team and Mongolia's Erchim team belonging to the Group I of the 2017 AFC Cup (East Asia) took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium here on Wednesday.
					 The Kigwancha team defeated its Mongolian rival 3:0 in the first match.
					
					 In the second match it beat the Mongolian team 7:0.
					
					 Meanwhile, the April 25 team of the DPRK defeated the Mongolian Erchim team 5:0 in the second match held in Mongolia on May 17.
					
					 Consequently, DPRK's April 25 team registered the highest scores in the Group I to advance into the next stage of 2017 AFC Cup.

articles.title: Absurdity of Trump Administration's New DPRK Policy Disclosed
articles.content:
Absurdity of Trump Administration's New DPRK Policy Disclosed
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Jon Sung Ho released a commentary Wednesday disclosing the deceptive and sly nature of the "4-point keynote" of the DPRK policy newly shaped by the Trump administration.
					 The commentary said:
					
					 The Trump administration had buckled down to brainstorming for months after tabling a variety of options for tackling the "nuclear issue of north Korea" and finally fixed its DPRK policy as "maximum pressure and engagement."
					
					 Recently, the administration detailed it and opened to public its "4-point keynote."
					
					 The "4-point keynote" officially signed by U.S. President Trump are as follows:
					
					 First, the U.S. does not recognize the DPRK as a nuclear weapons state.
					
					 Second, all possible tougher sanctions and pressure should be imposed on north Korea.
					
					 Third, the U.S. administration would not seek "regime change in north Korea."
					
					 Fourth, the nuclear issue should be finally solved through dialogue.
					
					 Terming the "keynote" a worn-out theory, the commentary shed light on their deceptive and sly nature as follows:
					
					 "The U.S. does not recognize north Korea as a nuclear weapons state" - this is the first item of the "keynote" signed by Trump.
					
					 It sounds like a lamentation of the one driven to bottomless despair or seems like reckless insistence.
					
					 The DPRK had access to the nuclear deterrent for self-defence, according to its independent decision as it was badly needed for preserving its dignity and vital rights from the nuclear threat posed by the U.S.
					
					 It was definitely not for securing someone's recognition.
					
					 Furthermore, the nukes firmly held by the DPRK are not the ones which should be dismantled if someone does not recognize it.
					
					 Clear is the fact that the "dismantlement of north Korea's nukes" can never come true now that the strategic position of the DPRK can never be brought to collapse.
					
					 As far as the second item of the "4-point keynote" is concerned, any sanctions and pressure can never work on the DPRK.
					
					 Tougher sanctions and pressure will only make the DPRK get stronger in its mental power and morale.
					
					 The ever-escalating ferocious sanctions and pressure by the hostile forces against the DPRK only harden its belief that it is advancing toward a victory.
					
					 Recently some dignitaries of the U.S. claimed the U.S. doesn't "seek the regime change in north Korea," earnestly calling on the public to believe it. It seemed so appealing in tone. 
					
					 Their words have now formally made the third item of the "4-point keynote".
					
					 The U.S. administration's talk about "ruling out regime change" is spewing out the venom of outrageous threat and blackmail. It actually means that it would make no scruple of bringing down the social system of the DPRK, not ruling out invasion if the DPRK fails to abandon its nukes.
					
					 The DPRK knows well about the way of protecting its social system.
					
					 It is the way of producing more perfect and powerful Juche weapons and nuclear attack means of the Korean style for striking terror into and annihilating the aggressors zealously watching the chance to violate the sovereignty of the DPRK and bring down its social system, and thus building a high fortress of self-defence.
					
					 The last item of the "keynote" is just the self-contradiction finally reached by the Trump administration while finding itself in dilemma and seeking a stop-gap measure.
					
					 If it was based on a reasonable logic, the last item should have been the first on the list. But the "dialogue" item occupied the last with a brand of "finally," only to reveal the ulterior purpose sought by the U.S.
					
					 This means that the U.S. seeks to subdue someone through maximum pressure and sanctions on the principle of pressure first and negotiation next and then make him come out to the negotiating table and wrest a surrender document from him.
					
					 Would a proper communication between human being and beast be possible though dialogue opens as long as the U.S. regards dialogue as a lever for extending pressure, nuclear weapons of the DPRK more valuable than its life as a bargaining chip to be bartered with something, and fails to drop black-hearted intent?
					
					 The "4-point keynote" adopted by the U.S. as detailed "maximum pressure and engagement" brought to light the poor IQ and narrow-minded vision of the White House policy-makers team.
					
					 No matter how desperately the U.S. and its vassal forces may try not to recognize the DPRK as a nuclear weapon state, the DPRK will remain unchanged in its position as a nuclear power and will speed up the diversification and modernization of nuclear force before the aggressors and provocateurs come to their senses.
					
					 No one can block the way of the DPRK bolstering its nuclear force according to the great line of simultaneously developing the two fronts.

articles.title: Achievements Made in Floriculture
articles.content:
Achievements Made in Floriculture
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Floriculture Institute under the DPRK State Academy of Sciences has recently laid the solid sci-tech foundation for mass-cultivating famous flowers.
					  The researchers of the institute succeeded in finding the temperature suited to bulb sleeping and establishing a technology of growing bulb suited to the specific conditions of the country for several years.
					
					 This year, the institute made tens of thousands of tulip and hyacinth plants bloom and contributed to sprucing up the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It also made contribution to decorating Ryomyong Street with blooming flower beds.

articles.title: WPK Demonstrates Its Invincible Dignity and Might
articles.content:
WPK Demonstrates Its Invincible Dignity and Might
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) has been strengthened into an ever-victorious party steering the final victory of the Juche revolution under the banner of independence, Songun (military-first) and socialism.
					 "Historical Experience of Building the Workers' Party of Korea", the famous work published by President Kim Il Sung on May 31, Juche 75 (1986), takes an important place in the historic course of the WPK.
					
					 The work is an encyclopedic document which comprehensively deals with a precious history, tradition and experience of the glorious WPK. It is also an important guideline indicating the way to implement the mission and tasks as the Juche-type revolutionary party.
					
					 The work perfectly expounds the theoretical and practical issues to be maintained in party building and activities. 
					
					 After the publication of the work, the heyday for building the revolutionary party of Juche type has been ushered in under the wise guidance of the great leaders.
					
					 The original ideas and theories of the party building clarified by the President served as the life-giving water which helped the WPK develop into the revolutionary party of Juche with the strong independent stand and the mother party taking care of the popular masses in a responsible manner. They also served as the fundamental source that helped the WPK discharge its role as the seasoned staff of the Juche revolution.
					
					 The WPK adhered to the Juche blood and developed into an ideological pure entity and an integral organization despite severe trials in the 1990s under the energetic guidance of leader Kim Jong Il who carried forward the idea and cause of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The WPK is fully demonstrating its invincible dignity and might as the promising party under the outstanding guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, possessed of brilliant ideological and theoretical wisdom, rare political ability and noble virtues, convened the Fourth Conference of the WPK, the Fourth Conference of Cell Secretaries of the WPK, the 8th Conference of Ideological Workers of the WPK and other historical meetings to open a new chapter for the development of the party.
					
					 The WPK is attaching top priority to their interests and convenience, regarding them as absolute and leading the destiny and future of the people in a responsible manner to the last.
					
					 The Korean people keenly feel that it is the great fortune that they hold in high esteem Kim Jong Un at the top post of the WPK, and are firmly convinced that the cause of the party is invincible as it is led by him.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Improvement of Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Improvement of Inter-Korean Relations
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Deterioration of the inter-Korean relations due to the south Korean puppet conservative group is the root cause of driving the south Korean society into the worst security unrest, diplomatic crisis and economic catastrophe, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in an article. 
					 It goes on:
					
					 The adoption of the June 15 joint declaration thawed the frozen north-south confrontation which had existed for more than half a century. 
					
					 In the wake of the adoption of the joint declaration, the inter-Korean relations of distrust and confrontation turned into those of national reconciliation and unity. Diverse dialogues and negotiations were promoted in different fields and national historic events took place to reconnect the broken vein and stratum of the nation.
					
					 Although there were turns and twists, the north and the south openheartedly exchanged opinions through dialogues and negotiations to solve difficult problems and the south Korean people dreamed of the day of national reunification with pleasure. Many business groups of south Korea received benefits from the boosting of the economic cooperation between the north and the south.
					
					 However, those eye-opening successes in the June 15 era and south Koreans' expectation and hope were mercilessly trampled down after the puppet conservative group, obsessed with north-south confrontation, took power.
					
					 The present south Korean authorities are at the crossroads. They are to follow in such footsteps of "security" uneasiness, diplomatic crisis and economic collapse or to overcome the crisis by improving the north-south relations.
					
					 The only way for south Korea to tide over the present worst crisis and difficulties is to improve the north-south relations.
					
					 The DPRK will as ever make positive efforts to pool the strength of our nation and achieve a great turn and changes in the north-south relations along the road indicated by the historic July 4 joint statement, June 15 joint declaration and October 4 declaration.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Hits U.S., S. Korean Warmongers' Military Provocations
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Hits U.S., S. Korean Warmongers' Military Provocations
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The U.S. has decided to extend the ongoing joint naval exercises in the East Sea of Korea by the end of June. The striking group of nuclear aircraft carrier Carl Vinson is participating in the rehearsal.
					 It is also planning to additionally deploy the task force of Ronald Reagan nuclear carrier from the Yokosuka base in order to stage the largest-ever joint exercises from next month.
					
					 Against this backdrop, the U.S. imperialist aggression forces present in south Korea and the puppet forces mobilized a large amphibious transport Tokdo for the first time to wage a drill for "removing nukes and WMDs" of the DPRK.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun in a commentary Wednesday condemns such moves as a vicious challenge and grave encroachment on the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK.
					
					 The commentary says:
					
					 Although the U.S. talked about what they called "ensuring the social system" and "the settlement of issue through dialogue and negotiations", it is nothing but a craft artifice to cover up its black-hearted intention for aggression and disarm the DPRK.
					
					 The present situation shows that the plan of the U.S. and south Korean trigger-happy forces to invade the north has entered a practical stage and that a war may break out on the Korean peninsula any time.
					
					 We do not want the escalation of the tensions but can not overlook their persistent moves for confrontation with the army and people of the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK remains steadfast in its revolutionary will to react to the provocations with the merciless deadly retaliatory strike and remove the source of war so that the warmonger can no longer disturb the peace on this land.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean warmongers are advised to behave themselves, well aware of the terrible disaster that will be caused by their reckless military provocations.

articles.title: No Force Can Check DPRK's Bolstering of Defence Capability: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
No Force Can Check DPRK's Bolstering of Defence Capability: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Scientists and technicians in the field of defence industry of the DPRK successfully conducted the test-launches of ground-to-ground medium-to-long-range strategic ballistic rocket Hwasong-12 and ground-to-ground intermediate-range strategic missile Pukguksong-2 for action.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says:
					
					 The successful test-launches powerfully demonstrated to the world the might of Juche Korea which has emerged a full-fledged nuclear power in the East and a leading rocket power in Asia.
					
					 The series of successful tests of strategic weapons have become a hot topic of foreign media. This is because the successes were made under an unimaginably severe situation.
					
					 Now the U.S. and its vassal forces are kicking up a row, shocked by the test-launches. It seems like a hysteric fit of stupid guys ignorant of where they are standing.
					
					 They should not run riot, understanding the faith and will of Songun Korea with the nuclear treasured sword of justice to annihilate the enemy.
					
					 Its army is ready to conduct an ICBM test-fire at any time and location by order of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK has already declared its will to blow up the dens of evils. The U.S. should know that it is not hot air.
					
					 No force can ever check the advance of the DPRK, a nuclear power and rocket power in the East.

articles.title: Trump Administration Urged to Choose Right Option
articles.content:
Trump Administration Urged to Choose Right Option
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- American media, experts and military personnel advise the Trump administration to be prudent as it is foolishly running amuck over the DPRK's successful test-fire of medium-to-long ballistic rocket Hwasong-12, Minju Joson Wednesday says in a commentary.
					 It goes on:
					
					 We fully displayed the invincible strength of Juche Korea and showed the world its will not to allow any attempt to pressure it by force as well as its capability for making unimaginable retaliatory strike.
					
					 Nevertheless, the Trump administration established the DPRK policy of "maximum pressure and engagement" and is offensively conducting an anti-DPRK campaign to isolate and stifle it in politics, economy, military, diplomacy and all other fields.
					
					 Far from drawing due lesson from the disgraceful ends of the preceding U.S. administrations, which suffered strategic failure after persistently pursuing the tough one-sided policy against the DPRK, it is still resorting to the dangerous gambling, not understanding the serious situation.
					
					 The Trump administration would be well advised to choose right option, mindful that it is standing at the crossroads of life and death.
					
					 The DPRK nuclear attack capability will grow stronger as long as the U.S. persists in the hostile policy, forgetting the past lesson.
					
					 The U.S. will be held wholly accountable for all the entailing consequences.

articles.title: Legalization of Jongyojo Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Legalization of Jongyojo Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The Teachers Union of south Korea (Jongyojo) reportedly held a rally in University Street of Seoul on May 27 to mark the 28th anniversary of the formation of Jongyojo, at which it demanded the withdrawal of decision on outlawing it and the liquidation of evils in the education field.
					 Attending the rally were more than 5,000 teachers from across south Korea.
					
					 Speakers there demanded the withdrawal of the decision on outlawing Jongyojo and the guarantee for three labor rights and political rights of teachers.
					
					 In a resolution the participants expressed their will to struggle to the last for above-said demands, the abolishment of neo-liberal education policy and other evil practices and probe into the truth behind the ferry Sewol disaster.
					
					 At the end of the rally, they marched to the Kwanghwamun Plaza.

articles.title: Smuggling Rampant among GIs in S. Korea
articles.content:
Smuggling Rampant among GIs in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Smuggling is getting rampant among GIs in south Korea.
					 According to the south Korean paper Herald Economy on May 26, GIs have smuggled devices for electric shock with a high output and air-guns into south Korea via the international military mail.
					
					 The number of detected smuggling cases of GIs by military mail this year alone totaled to 40.

articles.title: Anniversary of Afro-Asian Solidarity Committee of Korea Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Afro-Asian Solidarity Committee of Korea Marked
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- An event took place here on Tuesday to mark the 61st founding anniversary of the Afro-Asian Solidarity Committee of Korea.
					 Present there were the chairperson and members of the Afro-Asian Solidarity Committee of Korea and officials of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with the World People, the National Peace Committee of Korea and other social organizations and citizens.
					
					 Congratulatory messages from various social organizations in the country were read out at the event before a report was made.
					
					 The report referred to the successes made by the Afro-Asian Solidarity Committee of Korea in the efforts to contribute to the cause of independent reunification of Korea and boost the anti-imperialist solidarity, friendship and unity with peoples of Asia, Africa and Latin America for the past 61 years and set forth its future action program and tasks.
					
					 Noting that owing to the U.S. and its vassal forces' war moves and intervention, the extremely acute situation is prevailing on the Korean peninsula and tragic happenings are witnessed in various regions and countries, it stressed the need to further strengthen the international solidarity and cohesion with the anti-imperialist independent forces of the world in the struggle for opposing the imperialists' aggression and war moves against sovereign states and ensuring peace and security of the country and the region and the rest of the world.
					
					 Then, the participants watched a video dealing with the Committee's history of 61 years.

articles.title: U.S. Will Surely Yield to Korean People: Nepalese Personage
articles.content:
U.S. Will Surely Yield to Korean People: Nepalese Personage
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese paper Arpan on May 26 carried an article written by Manju Ratna Sakya, chairman of the Nepal Journalist Association, on the DPRK's successful test-fire of ground-to-ground medium-to-long range strategic ballistic missile Pukguksong-2.
					 The article said:
					
					 Days ago, the DPRK succeeded in the test-fire of Pukguksong-2 to be ready to go into action.
					
					 As soon as this news was reported, not only the U.S. and its vassal forces but also the UN are misleading the public opinion in a bid to tarnish the image of the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. should correct its wrong policy towards the DPRK and stop threatening or irritating the DPRK anymore.
					
					 The day when the U.S. would yield to the Korean people is sure to come.
					
					 It is not right attitude to criticize the DPRK's bolstering military capability for self-defence as illegal.

articles.title: U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK Protested in UK
articles.content:
U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK Protested in UK
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- A demonstration was staged outside the U.S. and south Korean embassies in UK on May 25 to protest against the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					 Taking part in the protest were personages of the New Communist Party of Britain, the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association UK and popular masses.
					
					 The chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy charged that the U.S. administration has introduced various strategic assets including aircraft carriers into the Korean peninsula and its vicinity to pose a threat to the DPRK.
					
					 He said:
					
					 We fully support the Korean people's just struggle against the U.S. provocative moves.
					
					 The U.S. should renounce its hostile policy toward the DPRK at once and get its aggression forces out of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The demonstrators took march, waving DPRK flags and chanting such slogans as "Korea is one", "Stop sanctions and war moves against the DPRK" and "Yankees, go home".

articles.title: Nigerians Demand Removal of Pro-U.S. Conservative Forces in S. Korea
articles.content:
Nigerians Demand Removal of Pro-U.S. Conservative Forces in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on its website an article calling for inheritance of the Kwangju uprisers' fighting spirit to remove the pro-U.S. conservative forces in south Korea on May 23.
					 The Kwangju Popular Uprising cleared south Korea of illusion about the U.S. imperialists and made the hot wind of anti-U.S. independence sweep it, shaking the colonial fascist rule to its very foundation, the article noted, adding:
					
					 The desire of the Kwangju resistance fighters has not yet been realized and the south Korean people have not recovered from the mental wounds they suffered.
					
					 The south Korean people should intensify the struggle to eradicate the group of pro-U.S. fascists engrossed in sycophancy, treachery, dictatorship and killings as they inflicted miserable destruction to the Park Geun Hye group of traitors.
					
					 Without termination of the U.S. colonial domination, their misfortune and pain can never be mitigated nor can the desire of the Kwangju resistance fighters come true.

articles.title: Pyongyang Sinmun conmemora 60o aniversario de su fundacion
articles.content:
Pyongyang Sinmun conmemora 60o aniversario de su fundacion 
Pyongyang, 31 de mayo (ACNC) -- El periodico Pyongyang Sinmun acogio el 60o aniversario de su fundacion. 
					El periodico politico masivo representa la posicion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y llama a los capitalinos a los meritos laborales. 
					
					El primero de junio del 46 (1957) de la Era Juche, el Presidente Kim Il Sung fundo la Editora de Pyongyang Sinmun y puso el titulo al periodico y enseno detalladamente el contenido, la forma y los metodos de redaccion.
					
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il presto atencion minuciosa para que se diversificara la redaccion de Pyongyang Sinmun conforme a sus caracteristicas y evaluo mucho a los articulistas sobresalientes.
					
					Durante 60 anos la Editora se ha desarrollado como un prestigioso organo de informacion del pais, bajo la sabia orientacion y atencion de los grandes Lideres antecesores, y ha cumplido con responsabilidad su deber de armar a los ciudadanos con la idea revolucionaria del Partido y llamarlos a la materializacion de las politicas del Partido.
					
					El acto conmemorativo tuvo lugar el dia 31 con la participacion del vicepresidente del Comite Central del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, y los funcionarios, periodistas, redactores y empleados de la Editora.

articles.title: Inaugurada exhibicion de fotos dedicada al aniversario 71 de ONC
articles.content:
Inaugurada exhibicion de fotos dedicada al aniversario 71 de ONC
Pyongyang, 31 de mayo (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada la exhibicion de fotos "Sol y girasoles" en homenaje al aniversario 71 de la fundacion de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea.
					En la ocasion se exhiben las fotos alusivas a las hazanas de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il y el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un quienes formaron a los miembros de la nueva generacion como futuros pilares de la Corea prospera.
					
					Ademas, se ven los retratos que presentan la vida alegre de los integrantes de la ONC que se preparan como sucesores de la causa revolucionaria del Juche y reservas de la otra del Songun en el regazo del Partido madre.
					
					La ceremonia inaugural tuvo lugar hoy en la Casa Central de la Juventud con la participacion de Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y del CC del PTC, los funcionarios de la UJS, los maestros y escolares de esta capital.
					
					  El discurso inaugural estuvo a cargo de Jon Yong Nam, primer secretario del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Kimilsungista-Kimjongilista.

articles.title: Efectuadas en RPDC actividades por el Dia Mundial de No Fumar
articles.content:
Efectuadas en RPDC actividades por el Dia Mundial de No Fumar
Pyongyang, 31 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 31 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo las actividades dedicadas al Dia Mundial de No Fumar.
					Asistieron a la ocasion los funcionarios de la rama de la salud publica y otras unidades relacionadas, los miembros de las representaciones de las organizaciones internacionales en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea incluso el representante de la Organizacion Mundial de la Salud, asi como los miembros de las embajadas de varios paises, acreditadas en la RPDC.
					
					En la ocasion hubo intervenciones.
					
					Tras referirse al tema de actividad de no fumar presentado este ano por la OMS, los oradores subrayaron que el tabaco causa diversas enfermedades, destruye seriamente la salud de los hombres y ejerce una influencia negativa a la vida socio-economica. 
					
					Recalcaron que es posible obtener resultados en las actividades de no fumar solo cuando se profundicen las investigaciones cientificas sobre los articulos de no fumar y se intensifiquen mas en los lugares publicos la inspeccion y control de acciones de fumar. 
					
					Seguidamente, hubo explicaciones sobre la enmendada y complementada ley de control de cigarrillo de la RPDC.
					
					Los participantes vieron un video intitulado "´Articulo preferido´ que amenaza la vida" y presenciaron la funcion artistica de los estudiantes de la Universidad Pedagogica Kim Hyong Jik. 
					
					Por otra parte, se desarrollaron el mismo dia las actividades propagandista de no fumar en los centros de propaganda higienica y los organos de curacion y prevencion del centro y de las provincias.

articles.title: Equipo 25 de Abril avanza a la siguiente fase del Torneo por la Copa de CAF de 2017
articles.content:
Equipo 25 de Abril avanza a la siguiente fase del Torneo por la Copa de CAF de 2017
Pyongyang, 31 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar este miercoles en el capitalino Estadio Kim Il Sung la segunda competencia entre el equipo coreano Kigwancha y el Erchim de Mongolia, pertenecientes al grupo I (de la region de Asia Oriental) del Torneo por la Copa de la Confederacion Asiatica de Futbol de 2017.
					En el primer partido Kigwancha gano con 3:0 a Erchim.
					
					En el juego de hoy, los coreanos vencieron a los mongoles por 7:0.
					
					Por otra parte, el otro equipo coreano 25 de Abril gano por 5:0 al Erchim en el segundo encuentro que tuvo lugar el dia 17 en Mongolia.
					
					Finalmente, el grupo 25 de Abril de la RPDC avanzara a la siguiente fase como lider de la zona I de la Copa de la CAF de 2017.
